Guard evaluation must proceed from the first to the last case block, one at a time, skipping case blocks whose pattern(s) don’t all succeed. (I. e. , guard evaluation must happen in order. ) Guard evaluation must stop once a case block is selected. ### 8. 6. 3. Irrefutable Case Blocks¶ An irrefutable case block is a match-all case block. A match statement may have at most one irrefutable case block, and it must be last. A case block is considered irrefutable if it has no guard and its pattern is irrefutable. A pattern is considered irrefutable if we can prove from its syntax alone that it will always succeed.
